description: Find out where and when you can take different types of cycles or bikes on our transport and National Rail services.

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["Find out where and when you can take different types of cycles on our transport and National Rail services."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Folded cycles"}
You can take folded cycles anywhere, at any time on all our transport services.
For buses, the driver can decide to not let you travel if it's too busy.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Non-folded cycles"}
You can take non-folded cycles on some services at specific times:
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Trains"}

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Taking cycles on trains map","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/cycles-on-public-transport.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 337KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Tube"}
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Allowed Monday to Friday before 07:30, between 09:30 and 16:00, and after 19:00","Allowed anytime on weekends and bank holidays"]}

{"template":"table","rows":[["\u003cstrong\u003eLine\u003c/strong\u003e ","\u003cstrong\u003eStations allowed\u003c/strong\u003e "],["Bakerloo","Between Queen's Park and Harrow \u0026 Wealdstone"],["Central","Between Leyton, Epping and Newbury Park (via Hainault only)\u003cbr /\u003eBetween White City, Ealing Broadway and West Ruislip"],["Circle","Anywhere"],["District","Anywhere"],["Hammersmith \u0026 City","Anywhere"],["Jubilee","Between Stratford and Canning Town\u003cbr /\u003eBetween Finchley Road and Stanmore"],["Metropolitan","Anywhere"],["Northern","Between Golders Green and Hendon Central\u003cbr /\u003eBetween Colindale and Edgware\u003cbr /\u003eBetween East Finchley, Mill Hill East and High Barnet"],["Piccadilly","Between Oakwood and Cockfosters\u003cbr /\u003eBetween Barons Court, Hounslow West and Uxbridge"]]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"London Overground"}
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Allowed Monday to Friday before 07:30, between 09:30 and 16:00, and after 19:00","Allowed anytime on weekends and bank holidays"]}
You can also take non-folded cycles on trains:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Leaving Liverpool Street station going towards Chingford, Enfield Town or Cheshunt, between 07:30 and 09:30","Arriving at Liverpool Street station from Chingford, Enfield Town or Cheshunt, between 16:00 and 19:00"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"TfL Rail"}
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Allowed anytime on weekends and bank holidays"]}
You can also take non-folded cycles from Monday to Friday, on trains:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Arriving at Liverpool Street or Stratford station before 07:30 and after 09:30","Leaving Liverpool Street or Stratford station before 16:00 and after 19:00","Arriving at London Paddington before 07:45 and after 09:45","Leaving London Paddington before 16:30 and after 19:00"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"DLR"}
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Allowed Monday to Friday before 07:30, between 09:30 and 16:00, and after 19:00","Allowed anytime on weekends and bank holidays"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"National Rail"}
Use PlusBike to find out where you can take cycles on National Rail services.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Bus and tram"}
Non-folded cycles can't be taken on buses and trams.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"River"}
Most river services allow non-folded cycles but you should check with them before you travel.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Emirates Air Line"}
You can take a non-folded cycle at any time.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Coaches"}
You need to check with the coach company to see if you can take a non-folded cycle.
